intro: Lepidium campestre, commonly known as field cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in racemes, and its leaves are alternate, pinnately lobed, and often hairy. It thrives in disturbed soils and is commonly found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Lepidium campestre is known for its peppery taste and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
